question.text: Which of the following is not a characteristic feature of meristematic cell?

options.text: It shows the ability to divide actively.
More than one vacuole is present.
It shows prominent nucleus and abundant cytoplasm.
The meristematic cell has a thin cell wall due to presence of only cellulose.

solution.text: The meristematic cell has a certain set of characteristic features. It is generally isodiametric in shape, has a prominent nucleus and abundant cytoplasm. Generally, these cells do not possess vacuoles. Their cell walls are composed of cellulose and are thin to facilitate cell division. The meristematic tissue contains compactly arranged cells.
